snippet: The main candidates have said that security and the economy are the most important issues to voters, but a debate returned repeatedly to questions about religious influence.
abstract: Televised debate between Egypt's presidential candidates returns repeatedly to questions about Islamic law, its place in Egypt and role of Islamist groups like Muslim Brotherhood; while candidates say public security and the economy are the most salient issues to voters, debate establishes the polarizing question of the role of Islam in public life as the main point of contrast among the leading candidates.

byline.contributor: Mayy El Sheikh and Kareem Fahim contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The main candidates have said that security and the economy are the most important issues to voters, but a debate returned repeatedly to questions about religious influence.

headline.seo: Egypt Election Dominated by Question of Islam
headline.main: Egyptian Campaign Focuses on Islam’s Role in Public Life
headline.print_headline: Egyptian Presidential Campaign Focuses on Islam’s Role in Public Life

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
